title.narrative: Access to environmental information through the promotion of the Escazú agreement

description.narrative: In Central America, so far only Nicaragua and Panama have signed and ratified the Escazú Agreement. Costa Rica and Guatemala have only signed it, but have not yet completed the ratification process before their Parliaments. El Salvador and Honduras have not signed. The objective of this Agreement is to guarantee the full and effective implementation in Latin America and the Caribbean of the rights of access to environmental information, environmental justice and the protection of land rights defenders. More information is available here: https://www.cepal.org/en/escazuagreement Escazú entered into force in 2021. It implies a challenge for the region considering that all information related to environmental and social impacts of any project should be public, for example, data on mining concessions, environmental impact studies and investment amounts. The third sector has a relevant role in this process, in order to promote its key cornerstones; 1. To guarantee the full and effective implementation of the Rights of Access to Environmental Information. 2. Increasing public participation in the decision-making process. 3. Facilitating access to justice in environmental matters, as well as the creation of instruments that allow for the protection and security of environmental defenders. Therefore, this project will provide information on the socio-environmental impacts of economic activities in the Central American region, in alignment with the Escazú agreement. In this sense, support will be delivered through different strategies, including capacity building of environmental groups and awareness campaigns.
